column4:
["
Are you looking to collaborate with other software engineers who appreciate your C++ expertise? Do you have an interest in natural language processing algorithms? Our client, a leading software development firm, is looking for a Software Engineer that is up for a challenge! Is this position the right one for you? If so, apply today!

We are seeking a creative and passionate Software Engineer to expand and complement our client's team of developers, to work on any and all aspects of our client's software platform, on a variety of initiatives, in their downtownPortland, OR office. We offer an exciting opportunity to work with a small, talented team on state-of-the-art machine learning technology.

You will be expected to:

Write high-performance, scalable software, mostly in C++, but also in Java, JavaScript, bash, Python, or whatever language is best suited to the task at hand
Collaborate with the team on all aspects of software development, from design to testing
Help troubleshoot errors or performance issues in our various deployment environments to help with root cause identification and resolution
Independently research and develop solutions to complex problems
Give estimates for your deliverables, and meet them

Some specific things you may do, depending on your skills and our evolving needs:


Take ownership of a web service and application that manages the deployment, patching, and monitoring of the web services that make up our platform. Improve the monitoring and alerting systems so we have more detailed knowledge of what is happening at any time and improved notification of any problems.
Add features to our search system to make better use of information other than the relevance of the query to the document text. This includes time, references and links to and from other documents, author and ownership information, and more.
Work on improving our deep learning system. Evaluate recent research for applicability to our domain. Prototype and test different algorithms and integrate improvements into our production system.
Add functionality to our Semantic Map search result visualization and clustering UI, and write other visualizations that expose the value we add to structured and unstructured text data.


Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related discipline
Proficiency in C++ or Java
Strong programming fundamentals, including knowledge of algorithms, data structures, design patterns, concurrent programming, distributed systems, optimization, and different programming paradigms
Experience with common Linux command line tools

Desired Qualifications:


Any skill set or experience that can help us and isn't shared by a present member of our team. Some possibilities: recurrent nets, JavaScript frameworks, GPU programming, linear algebra, distributed filesystems, different programming languages.
Knowledge of algorithms for information retrieval, machine learning, or deep learning
Experience integrating and modifying open-source projects
Experience with REST web service design and development
Knowledge of map-reduce and other large-scale data processing strategies

For IMMEDIATE consideration, Call Dan Birnbaum TODAY at 5._8._5._2._7._2._9._0._5._1. Resumes can be sent directly to [ Link removed ] -  Click here to apply to C++ or Java Software Engineer
Nesco Resource is an equal employment opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristics with respect to employment opportunities.
\xa0

Recommended skills
C++ (Programming Language)
Search (Computer Science)
Algorithms
Prototype (Computer Science)
Data Structures
Java (Programming Language)

"]

["

Power the PossibilitiesThe CDK Global technology team is looking for collaborative innovators who are passionate about making their mark on emerging enterprise software products. We're building and developing cloud technology for the automotive retail industrythat will change the landscape for automotive dealers, original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and the customers they serve.Be Part of Something BiggerEach year, more than three percent of the U.S. gross domestic product (GDP) is attributed to the auto industry, which flows through our customer, the auto dealer. It's time you joined an evolving marketplace where research and developmentinvestment is measured in the tens of billions. It's time you were a part of something bigger.We're expanding our workforce - engineers, architects, developers and more - onboarding early adopters who can optimize, pivot and keep pace with ever-evolving development roadmaps and applications.Join Our TeamGrowth potential, flexibility and material impact on the success and quality of a next-gen, enterprise software product make CDK an excellent choice for those who thrive in challenging, fast-paced engineering environments.The possibilities for impact are endless. We have exceptional opportunities to evolve our industry by driving change through new technology.
If you're ready for high-impact, you're ready for CDK.

Position Description:
This is an Infrastructure Database Design and Administration position primarily (but not limited to) Oracle and PostgreSQL. Infrastructure Design Engineer (IE) is responsible for enterprise wide work initiatives, projects and provide solutions to CDK's entire portfolio of products\xa0from mature to emerging technologies. The environment is dynamic and changes can be driven by technology advancements,\xa0Organizational objectives to improve efficiency and service levels via automation, enhancing business agility or effectively\xa0managing strategic mergers, acquisitions and spin offs.This position requires technical liaison between operations teams, engineers and architects, provide critical design and operational insight to upcoming implementations and strategies, ability to deliver results under time sensitive deadlines, great collaboration skills and solid understanding of multiple technologies.
LOCATION OPEN TO PORTLAND, OR/ AUSTIN, TX/ HOFFMAN ESTATES, IL

Responsibilities:

Provide technical and consulting leadership in maintaining the database environments.
Participates in planning efforts with stakeholders and IT groups.
Analyze business process application requirements to produce formal analysis and design documents with minimal supervision.
Provide cost/time estimates, capacity planning of database environments.
Recommends changes/enhancements for improved systems availability, reliability and performance.
Institutes process for continuous improvement.
Evaluate new technology from time to time to benefit the applications or administer database.
Reviews and certifies support documents.
Host meetings, provide guidance and support to R&D/ DBA team.
Assist on critical production issues, identify root cause and provide mitigation plan.
Oversees conformance to departmental standards, meet audit and compliance processes and assist in collecting audit evidence as required.

Skills Required:

Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent education experience
10+ years of experience as Oracle DBA with RAC One Node, Multi-node RAC expertise.
3-5 years of experience as PostgreSQL Database Administrator/Architect on Linux environment.
Hands-on experience in AWS cloud technologies such as AWS RDS, EC2, Amazon Aurora etc.
Experience in Oracle database Upgrade and/or Migration to latest version of Oracle 18c/19c.
Experience in Postgres Database Upgrade and/or Migration to latest version of Postgres 11.x/12.x on-premise and in Cloud.
Hands-On Experience in Oracle 11g & 12C RAC Configurations, ASM Management, Disk addition/deletion/rebalancing.
Experience on database High Availability and Disaster Recovery configurations, Active Data Guard, Postgres repmgr.
Perform routine database administration work e.g. database installation, configuration, patching, monitor database health, performance tuning, backup/restore etc.
Programming experience in Linux shell script, Python for Automation of routine database processes.
Working knowledge MS SQL Server, Azure DB and MySQL.
Experience using agile methodologies, Jira and other Atlassian products.
Familiarity with ITIL process.
Good communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to prioritize, multi-task, and perform effectively under pressure.
May be scheduled for after hours on-call or escalation support


CDK Global knows you have passions outside of work. You have family, friends, sporting events, and lots of things going on. That's why we offer a comprehensive benefits package to not only take care of you but your family as well. All of our benefits are effective the first day of employment including 401K matching, paid time off to re-energize, donate your time to volunteer in your community, and tuition reimbursement to name a few.
At CDK, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives they provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status. 
  


Recommended skills
Performance Tuning
Capacity Planning
Database Administration
Administration
Cloud Technologies
Amazon Web Services

"]

100% Remote Senior Python Developers Needed @ Fast-growing SaaS Tech StartupThis Jobot Job is hosted by: Luke SwiftAre you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply on company site" button and sending us your resume.Salary: $100,000 - $130,000A bit about us:Our powerful SaaS platform connects customers to real estate agents and help them save money in the process (sellers get a discount on commission, buyers get a rebate on their home purchase).We are now seeking several REMOTE Software Engineers (Mid/Senior level) with a background developing customer-facing SaaS and web-based applications experience, primarily with Python and Django. In this role, you'll do a lot of paired-programming with several members of our team the first few months in order to familiarize you with our existing systems and to build relationships with the rest of the Engineering team. You either should enjoy it or at least be willing to do paired-programming, otherwise this isn't the right opportunity for you. They should be well-versed with server-side technologies such as RESTful APIs, Amazon Web Services, CI/CD tools, and databases (PostgreSQL/NoSQL). Any experience with JavaScript and React.js is highly desired, but not required as we will ramp you up on them and any of the other technologies we use in no time. Lastly, this is a great time to get in on ground floor working alongside the Founders, CTO, and a key hire in shaping the way the organization's future goes. If this sounds like you, please apply now!Why join us?
 Marquee Product!
 WORK FROM HOME!
 Accelerated Career Growth!
Job DetailsDay to Day:
 Develop, maintain, and enhance our powerful SaaS platform
 Take ownership by creating your own technical specs because as a small team, you are given personal ownership of the planning processes.
 Collaborate a lot with each other and with product stakeholders. 
 Participate in the spec processes for new features and epics on our roadmap, and you'll help others resolve issues when they have questions about certain parts of the codebase that you've gained familiarity with. 
 Establish strong working relationships with individuals inside and outside of Engineering, and you'll have a clear understanding of both our customer journey and the workflows of our internal stakeholders.
 Tackle small bugs and features while performing root-cause analysis for bugs independently, escalating to other teammates when you need a second set of eyes. 
 Use the business context you've picked up to discuss the priority of features and bugs in the backlog. 
 Advocate a new trend or tool that will help us perform root-cause analysis more easily when issues come up.
Requirements:
 4+ years of Software Development experience
 At least 2 years of development experience on a consumer-facing SaaS or web-based application products
 Experience and/or willingness to participate in paired-programming (No Exceptions)
 Advanced with Python programming 
 Experience with Django or similar python web framework (Flask)
 Experience with RESTful API design & development
 Experience with RDBMs (PostgreSQL) and NoSQL databases
 Experience working within an Amazon Web Services (AWS) environment
 Familiar with CI/CD and DevOps tools and best practices is highly desired
Nice to have skills:, but not required: 
 Proficient with web technologies such as JavaScript, HTML, CSS
 Experience with ReactJS is highly desired
Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply on company site" button.
\xa0

Recommended skills
No Sql
Amazon Web Services
Java Script (Programming Language)
Api Design
Cascading Style Sheets (Css)
Hyper Text Markup Language (Html)

['

Job Responsibilities:
Troubleshoot system issues and help analyze application issues through such techniques as interpreting log files, reading stack traces, and data analysis to identify root cause of issues.
Respond to Service Requests, system alerts and incidents per SLA and lead the troubleshooting of outages and other incidents of the respective systems.
Work with Infrastructure team to install, maintain, configure, administer and optimize the respective systems.
Work with operation team to monitor the respective systems such as server health, performance, capacity, etc., and respond rapidly and effectively to risky trends before they become issues.
Coordinate production deployment of the respective development team, provide risk analysis, and support post-production validation and monitoring.
Develop business supporting tools, which help resolve time-sensitive business issue,
Develop utilities/batch jobs/scripts to improve system performance, availability, etc.
Start initial research of Service Desk tickets for the respective development team, and triage them according to the findings.
Write Root Cause Analysis for the production issues
Opening problem cases with vendors as needed and driving them to conclusion.


Position Requirements: Experience:
Hands on development experience in respective systems.
Hands on experience in J2EE OR Core Java technology.
Experience with setting up, administering, performance tuning of an enterprise system.
Experience with Database development in Oracle OR similar RMDBS.
Working Experience of Web Services (SOAP and REST), messaging development and Integration architecture.
Experience in scripting tools such as Jython/Python is a plus.
Knowledge of AWS Cloud technologies such as EC2, RDS, Lambda, Elastic Search, Cloud Watch, etc., is a plus.
Knowledge with infrastructure/application architecture is a plus.
Excellent analytical ability to trouble shoot issues in Production environment.
Outstanding work ethic and commitment to organization success.
Willingness to adapt to and self-learn new technologies and deliver on them.
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, related technical degree, or equivalent industry experience, and a minimum two years of IT experience.
#CB
 
 
 
 
Founded in Mount Laurel, NJ in 1990, Freedom Mortgage has since grown into one of the largest and fastest-growing privately owned full-service residential lenders in the USA. Licensed in all 50 states, Washington D.C., Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands, Freedom Mortgage has over 5000 employees nationwide, proudly servicing $225.6 billion, and is still growing.

Our mission is to foster homeownership in America. Freedom is a leader in VA mortgage lending and is one of the mortgage industry’s largest philanthropic supporters of the USO and military families through its Team Freedom Cares philanthropic arm. 
 

Locations include suburban Philadelphia and Fishers, IN, two regions where we were named Top Workplaces. We also have large operating centers countrywide, including these desirable markets: Beaverton , OR; Boca Raton, FL; Columbia, MD; Jacksonville, FL; Melville, NY; Plano, TX; San Dimas, CA; Tempe, AZ; Troy, MI and Woodbridge, VA.

If you seek a sense of community, top training, opportunity for advancement, a comprehensive benefits package and reward and recognition program, look no further.

Freedom Mortgage Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to workforce diversity. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, or their status as a protected veteran or an individual with disabilities. Local applicants encouraged to apply. Employment contingent upon successful completion of background investigation. Smoke-free workplace. Drug-free work environment. Excellent benefits package including medical, dental, vision and 401(k). All resumes are held in confidence. Only candidates whose profiles closely match requirements will be contacted during this search. LENDER NMLS ID:2767  Equal Opportunity Employer- Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans 
 
\xa0

Recommended skills
Architecture
Analysis
Amazon Web Services
Search (Computer Science)
Hardworking And Dedicated
Integration

']

Voca Technology\xa0has immediate openings available for Research Software Engineer\xa0 professionals in Beaverton, OR!\xa0 If you are interested, please forward your resume to Angie Le at [ Email address blocked ] -  Click here to apply to Research Software Engineer and call her at 503.714.3009. Thanks!

Assignment Details\xa0
\xa0
Job Description

This position is for a software engineer in the Center for Spatial Systems Biomedicine. Client\xa0 is committed to leading the development of next-generation patient care through discoveries made by data analytics, enabled by values of open access data, open source code, highly collaborative team science, and professional software engineering methodologies. As a software developer, you will develop data management applications for genomic, imaging, and clinical data and metadata. You are committed to both patient care and transparent sharing of information, enthusiastic about working in a team that finds quantitative insights in complex data, and an organized self-starter who enjoys creative freedom in solving computational and organizational challenges.
Responsibilities:

Develop and extend analytics and data management applications.
Develop tools for extraction, transformation, and load (ETL) of complex clinical and genomic data into data management applications
Develop and extend tools for visualizing and searching data stored in supported data management applications
Follow standards for software development, including requirements, design, code, test, quality, configuration and release management processes, and project management.
Work with and support team members to build common code repositories, test frameworks, and continuous integration processes.
Work with users to elicit, document, and synthesize functional and data requirements


Key Responsibilities & Performance Standards

Develop extraction, transformation, and load (ETL) workflows for clinical, genomic, and imaging data and metadata into data management systems for precision oncology
Develop and extend tools for visualizing and searching data stored in supported data management applications
Support team members, training as applicable
Follow standards for software development, including requirements, design, code, test, quality, configuration and release management processes, and project management.
Work with team members to build a common code repository, comprehensive test framework, and continuous integration processes
\xa0



Qualifications:

Required:

Master’ s Degree with major courses in relevant field and 3 years of relevant experience. OR
Bachelor’ s Degree with major courses in field of research and 5 years of relevant experience.
Master’ s Degree with major courses in relevant field and 3 years of relevant experience. OR
Bachelor’ s Degree with major courses in field of research and 5 years of relevant experience.

Able to program in multiple programming languages, preferably Python, JavaScript, Java, or SQL
Critical thinker, with willingness and ability to learn new subject areas
Excellent communication, analytical, and organizational skills, both written and verbal.




Preferred:

Experience in professional software development techniques such as bug and issue tracking systems, use of distributed source code management systems, writing unit tests.
Experience developing multi-tier web applications.
Experience with relational databases.



Shift:

Monday-Friday: 8am-5pm


Voca: The Spirit of Work
IND-IT
\xa0

column4: ['Power the PossibilitiesThe CDK Global technology team is looking for collaborative innovators who are passionate about making their mark on emerging enterprise software products. column4: ['ABOUT POET INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY', '', 'In POET Information Technology (IT), we proactively deliver a high level of service to empower our business units to create more value for POET. We work closely as a team, in a fun, fast-paced, changing environment to plan, execute and support IT initiatives. We recognize our end users as partners and work together to provide innovative and current solutions. ', '', 'JOB SUMMARY', 'The Full Stack Developer, with a data sciences and warehousing focus, will architect, design, develop, and test data lake and warehousing solutions, ETL needs, software integrations and be the primary technical point of contact for POET’s analytics platform and business intelligence needs of the business. Developers will perform a variety of programming assignments requiring knowledge of established programming procedures and data processing requirements. This position’s area of focus will also include data modeling, data mining, data transformation, data visualizations, report writing, and some web application development.
